labels: International Standards of Classification Country Alpha-3 Categorization
Year for merging (observations are 2020 or closest)
(scovratl) Coverage of the labor force for work-injury policy, source = SIED 2020
(scovratp) Coverage of the entire adult population for work-injury policy, source = SIED 2020
(azrr26si) Standard net single worker replacement rate for total 26-week period of work accident benefit, excluding prior half-year's wage income from numerator and denominator, source SIED 2020
(azrr26fa) Standard net familied worker replacement rate for total 26-week period of work accident benefit, excluding prior half-year's wage income from numerator and denominator, source = SIED 2020

(az4ind) (= a1stners+a1stnerf+azrr26si+azrr26fa)/4. Average of four components: a single person and a four-person family, for first week after waiting days and 26 weeks with benefits, source = SIED 2020

The replacement rate for a permanent disability compared to previous wages, or average wage if so calculated, in the first 12 months of disability. Coded from Social Policy Programs Throughout the World, or best available info. Source = GWIP v2.0
The length of time a person who has a permanent disability caused by a work-injury is covered, source = GWIP v2.0
The replacement rate for a temporary incapacity to work compared to previous wages, or average wage if so calculated, in the first 6 months of incapacity, source = GWIP v2.0
The length of time a perosn who has a temporary incapacity to work can recieve benefits. Unlimited = until healed. Source = GWIP v2.0
If any duration of work or other qualifications other than a work-injury have an impact on the rate or duration of benefits, source = GWIP v2.0
The ratio of income for a person with disability to one without, source = ILO 2020
Disposable Gini. The income inequality Gini after taxes and transfers, source = Solt 2020
Market Gini. The income inequality Gini before taxes and transfers, source = ILO 2020
Percent of labor force de Facto covered by work-injury policy, source Global Empoyment Injury Protection ILO 2014
NA
Labor force participation among adult females, source = ILO 2020
Labor force participation among all adults, source = ILO 2020

Gross Domestic Product per capita, source = Maddison 2020
Population, source = Maddison 2020
